alert.note: Alert for Butte; Calaveras; Colusa; El Dorado; Glenn (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 9:40AM PDT until March 15 at 10:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. Several reports of minor flooding impacting roadways, as well as some reports of mud and rock slides from flooding in the foothills has been received this morning. * WHERE...Portions of central and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Placer. In northern California, Amador, Butte, Calaveras, Colusa, El Dorado, Glenn, Nevada, Plumas, Sacramento, San Joaquin, Shasta, Sierra, Solano, Stanislaus, Sutter, Tehama, Tuolumne, Yolo and Yuba. * WHEN...Until noon PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 936 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy to moderate rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sacramento, Stockton, Modesto, Elk Grove, Roseville, Vallejo, Fairfield, Vacaville, Redding, Chico, Citrus Heights, Tracy, Folsom, Turlock, Davis, Rocklin, Woodland, Ceres, Benicia and Paradise. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Butte; Calaveras; Colusa; El Dorado; Glenn
